Kris je odpotoval na zdravljenje v ZDA
06 Nov 2019, 12:37 by STA

Mali Kris iz Kopra, ki ima spinalno mišično atrofijo in za katerega je društvo Palčica pomagalčica zbiralo denar za zdravljenje v tujini, je danes s starši z Brnika odpotoval na zdravljenje v Los Angeles. "Z nami je zdravnik in imamo vse, kar potrebujemo," sta pred odhodom novinarjem povedala Krisova starša, Ana Jerak in Matteo Zudich.



Foto: Sta

BRNIK, KOPER > Let preko Kanade bo trajal približno 14 ur, obisk zdravnika v Los Angelesu pa je načrtovan v petek, je povedala Ana Jerak. Prvih nekaj dni bodo nastanjeni v hotelu, potem pa se bodo preselili v stanovanje. Enaindvajsetmesečnemu Krisu, ki bo na letalu ležal, bodo pot krajšale risanke.



Ne vedo, kdaj se vračajo, saj bo vse odvisno od poteka zdravljenja. A po načrtu naj bi v ZDA ostali od dveh do štirih mesecev.
Let z zasebnim letalom je plačal srbski poslovnež Miodrag Kostić. "Za nas pomoč gospoda Kostića pomeni veliko olajšanje," je dejala Jerakova. "Vse življenje mu bomo hvaležni. To, da nesebično pomaga otroku, ki ga osebno sploh ne pozna, je velika gesta," je poudarila.



Učinki zdravila zolgensma, ki je trenutno dostopno le v ZDA, bodo po predvidevanjih hitri. "A je še težko reči, kako bo v resnici, saj ni pravil," je opozorila. Račun za zdravilo v višini 2,23 milijona dolarjev je že poravnan, lečeči zdravnik pa bo naknadno sporočil, ali bodo denimo potrebne dodatne preiskave.
Sporočil, ki jih prejemajo od ljudi, ki želijo Krisu uspešno zdravljenje, je veliko. Z Matteom Zudichem skušata odgovoriti vsem, "ker je res lepo, da nas podpirajo", je izpostavila.
Kris ima tudi instagram profil, na katerem bodo sporočali, kako poteka zdravljenje, je zagotovila.
Društvo Palčica pomagalčica je s pomočjo številnih Slovencev le v nekaj tednih zbralo 2,3 milijona evrov, potrebnih za zdravljenje, ki bi lahko rešilo življenje Krisu. Ob množičnem odzivu so znesek krepko presegli.

Chris traveled to the US for treatment
06 Nov 2019, 12:37 by STA

Little Kris from Koper, who has spinal muscular atrophy and for whom the Aid Society has raised money for medical treatment abroad, today went to Los Angeles for treatment with his parents from Brnik. "She's a doctor with us and we have everything we need," Kris's parents, Ana Jerak and Matteo Zudich, told reporters before leaving.



Photo: Sta

BRNIK, KOPER> The flight through Canada will take about 14 hours, and a visit to the doctor in Los Angeles is scheduled for Friday, Ana Jerak said. They will be staying at the hotel for the first few days, then they will move into the apartment. Twenty-one-month-old Kris lying on a plane will be shortened by cartoons.



They do not know when they are returning, as it will all depend on the course of treatment. But the plan is to stay two to four months in the US.
The flight by private jet was paid for by Serbian businessman Miodrag Kostic. "For us, Mr. Kostic's assistance is a great relief," Jerak said. "We will be grateful to him all his life. It is a great gesture to selflessly help a child he doesn't even know personally," she emphasized.



The effects of zolgensma, currently only available in the US, are expected to be rapid. "But it is still hard to say how it will be, as there are no rules," she recalled. The $ 2.23 million bill for the drug has already been settled, and the treating doctor will subsequently announce if, for example, further investigations are needed.
The messages they receive from people who wish Kris a successful treatment are many. She and Matte Zudich are trying to answer everyone "because it's really nice that they support us," she said.
Kris also has an instagram profile to let you know how the treatment is going, she assured.
With the help of many Slovenians, the Palčica Helper Society raised a total of 2.3 million euros in just a few weeks for the treatment that could save Kris's life. At mass response, the amount was far exceeded.
